articles.title: Serbian president cancels visit to Serbs in Montenegro
articles.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Serbia’s president on Saturday canceled a private visit to Montenegro he'd planned amid a row between the two former Balkan allies over a new law that Serbs say discriminates against the Serbian Orthodox Church.
articles.content:
BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) Serbias president on Saturday canceled a private visit to Montenegro he'd planned amid a row between the two former Balkan allies over a new law that Serbs say discriminates against the Serbian Orthodox Church.

articles.author: By GERALD IMRAY AP Sports Writer
articles.title: Broad, Anderson lift England as South Africa slips to 60-3
articles.description: Veteran fast bowlers Stuart Broad and James Anderson injected new life into England to send South Africa sliding to 60-3 on Day 2 of the second test on Saturday.
articles.content:
Veteran fast bowlers Stuart Broad and James Anderson injected new life into England to send South Africa sliding to 60-3 on Day 2 of the second test on Saturday.
Broad struck twice before lunch, helped by a dazzling diving catch by Ben Stokes in the slips, a… [+1129 chars]

articles.title: Chinese league bans basketball fan for life, suspends coach
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — China's professional basketball league banned a Jiangsu Dragons supporter for life on Saturday and suspended the team's head coach for a second game after the pair clashed earlier this week.
articles.content:
BEIJING (AP) China's professional basketball league banned a Jiangsu Dragons supporter for life on Saturday and suspended the team's head coach for a second game after the pair clashed earlier this week.

articles.title: Vogue Italia eschews photos for sustainable January issue
articles.description: ROME (AP) — Vogue Italia has produced its first issue of the new year and decade with an eye on sustainability, substituting fashion illustrations for photographs in an effort to reduce the environmental impact associated with staging fashion photo shoots…

articles.author: By VADIM GHIRDA and ANDREEA ALEXANDRU
articles.title: AP Photos: Disabled Romanian children given chance to shine
articles.description: BUCHAREST, Romania (AP) — During Romania's communist era, children with disabilities were shunned, often locked away in institutions or kept at home and deprived of schooling and social interactions.
articles.content:

articles.author: By NINIEK KARMINI Associated Press
articles.title: 53 dead in landslides, flash floods in Indonesia's capital
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Landslides and floods triggered by torrential downpours have left at least 53 people dead in and around Indonesia's capital, as rescuers struggled to search for people apparently buried under tons of mud, officials said Saturday.
articles.content:
